description.narrative: Finn Church Aid (FCA) bears responsibility for the security and safety of their staff as a matter of duty of care in the execution of the day to day activities. This applies to all FCA staff; headquarters, mission office expatriate and national staff, auth orised visitors, volunteers in the field and interns and any other person working formally and directly with FCA.In order to work and live safer in countries where situation may deteriorate rapidly, the Security and Safety of personnel is paramount and fou ndation to all FCA’s activities. The acceptance and compliance of Security and Safety procedures, protocols, operating principles and internal guidelines by staff and all other persons involved is compulsory and concurrent with the start of any kind of w ork with FCA.Objectives:In order for us to perform our work as safely as possible in changing, volatile and hostile contexts, we invest in the continuous training and learning of our employees. Our target is to guarantee that our employees have healthy and safe working conditions to support working abilities mission wide.This is done by increasing security and safety awareness and personal safety procedures through training. In addition we follow Minimum Operating Standards (security related requirements) i ssued by Act Alliance.Activities: • standardised security plans and protocols; standard operating procedures and contingency plans• travel security training for HQ staff and visitors• emergency first-aid training for HQ and field staff• security an d safety training for field staff• crisis management training for crisis management team in HQ• hostile environment awareness training (HEAT) for HQ personnel visiting frequently to high-risk areas• hostile environment awareness training (HEAT) for f ield staff working in high-risk areas and locations• personal protection and hygiene awareness for personnel working in pandemic and epidemic areasAll above mentioned and listed will be implemented through hands-on training with examples and practical ex ercises focus being to main risks and threats identified by Regional Representative and personnel in country.
